verses.verse: My soul <S%H5315><s%> is weary <S%H5354><s%> <S%H8804><s%> of my life <S%H2416><s%>; I will leave <S%H5800><s%> <S%H8799><s%> my complaint <S%H7879><s%> upon myself; I will speak <S%H1696><s%> <S%H8762><s%> in the bitterness <S%H4751><s%> of my soul <S%H5315><s%>.

I will say <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%> unto 'Elohim <S%H433><s%>, Do not condemn <S%H7561><s%> <S%H8686><s%> me; shew <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8685><s%> me wherefore thou contendest <S%H7378><s%> <S%H8799><s%> with me.

Is it good <S%H2895><s%> <S%H8804><s%> unto thee that thou shouldest oppress <S%H6231><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, that thou shouldest despise <S%H3988><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the work <S%H3018><s%> of thine hands <S%H3709><s%>, and shine <S%H3313><s%> <S%H8689><s%> upon the counsel <S%H6098><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> ?
Hast thou eyes <S%H5869><s%> of flesh <S%H1320><s%>? or seest <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8799><s%> thou as man <S%H582><s%> seeth <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8800><s%> ?
Are thy days <S%H3117><s%> as the days <S%H3117><s%> of man <S%H582><s%>? are thy years <S%H8141><s%> as man's <S%H1397><s%> days <S%H3117><s%>,
That thou enquirest <S%H1245><s%> <S%H8762><s%> after mine iniquity <S%H5771><s%>, and searchest <S%H1875><s%> <S%H8799><s%> after my sin <S%H2403><s%> ?
Thou knowest <S%H1847><s%> that I am not wicked <S%H7561><s%> <S%H8799><s%>; and there is none that can deliver <S%H5337><s%> <S%H8688><s%> out of thine hand <S%H3027><s%>.

Thine hands <S%H3027><s%> have made <S%H6087><s%> <S%H8765><s%> me and fashioned <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8799><s%> me together <S%H3162><s%> round about <S%H5439><s%>; yet thou dost destroy <S%H1104><s%> <S%H8762><s%> me.

Remember <S%H2142><s%> <S%H8798><s%>, I beseech thee, that thou hast made <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8804><s%> me as the clay <S%H2563><s%>; and wilt thou bring <S%H7725><s%> me into dust <S%H6083><s%> again <S%H7725><s%> <S%H8686><s%> ?
Hast thou not poured me out <S%H5413><s%> <S%H8686><s%> as milk <S%H2461><s%>, and curdled <S%H7087><s%> <S%H8686><s%> me like cheese <S%H1385><s%> ?
Thou hast clothed <S%H3847><s%> <S%H8686><s%> me with skin <S%H5785><s%> and flesh <S%H1320><s%>, and hast fenced <S%H7753><s%> <S%H8787><s%> me with bones <S%H6106><s%> and sinews <S%H1517><s%>.
Thou hast granted <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8804><s%> me life <S%H2416><s%> and favour <S%H2617><s%>, and thy visitation <S%H6486><s%> hath preserved <S%H8104><s%> <S%H8804><s%> my spirit <S%H7307><s%>.
And these things hast thou hid <S%H6845><s%> <S%H8804><s%> in thine heart <S%H3824><s%>: I know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8804><s%> that this is with thee.
If I sin <S%H2398><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, then thou markest <S%H8104><s%> <S%H8804><s%> me, and thou wilt not acquit <S%H5352><s%> <S%H8762><s%> me from mine iniquity <S%H5771><s%>.

If I be wicked <S%H7561><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, woe <S%H480><s%> unto me; and if I be righteous <S%H6663><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, yet will I not lift up <S%H5375><s%> <S%H8799><s%> my head <S%H7218><s%>. I am full <S%H7649><s%> of confusion <S%H7036><s%>; therefore see <S%H7202><s%> <S%H8798><s%> <S%H8676><s%> <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8798><s%> thou mine affliction <S%H6040><s%>;

For it increaseht <S%H1342><s%> <S%H8799><s%>. Thou huntest <S%H6679><s%> <S%H8799><s%> me as a fierce lion <S%H7826><s%>: and again <S%H7725><s%> <S%H8799><s%> thou shewest thyself marvellous <S%H6381><s%> <S%H8691><s%> upon me.

Thou renewest <S%H2318><s%> <S%H8762><s%> thy witnesses <S%H5707><s%> against me, and increasest <S%H7235><s%> <S%H8686><s%> thine indignation <S%H3708><s%> upon me <S%H5978><s%>; changes <S%H2487><s%> and war <S%H6635><s%> are against me.

Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth <S%H3318><s%> <S%H8689><s%> out of the womb <S%H7358><s%>? Oh that I had given up the ghost <S%H1478><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and no eye <S%H5869><s%> had seen <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8799><s%> me!
I should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried <S%H2986><s%> <S%H8714><s%> from the womb <S%H990><s%> to the grave <S%H6913><s%>.

Are not my days <S%H3117><s%> few <S%H4592><s%>? cease <S%H2308><s%> <S%H8798><s%> <S%H8675><s%> <S%H2308><s%> <S%H8799><s%> then, and let me alone <S%H7896><s%> <S%H8798><s%> <S%H8675><s%> <S%H7896><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, that I may take comfort <S%H1082><s%> <S%H8686><s%> a little <S%H4592><s%>,
Before I go <S%H3212><s%> <S%H8799><s%> whence I shall not return <S%H7725><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, even to the land <S%H776><s%> of darkness <S%H2822><s%> and the shadow of death <S%H6757><s%>;

A land <S%H776><s%> of darkness <S%H5890><s%>, as darkness <S%H652><s%> itself; and of the shadow of death <S%H6757><s%>, without any order <S%H5468><s%>, and where the light <S%H3313><s%> <S%H8686><s%> is as darkness <S%H652><s%>.
